title: Complete Setup Guide: Automated Emails from Google Sheets
description: Learn how to automatically send emails whenever a new row is added to your Google Sheet. Perfect for notifications, alerts, and automated responses.

steps.title: Welcome to Your First n8n Workflow! üëã
steps.description: This tutorial will guide you through setting up automated emails triggered by new Google Sheets rows. By the end, you'll have a working automation that sends an email every time someone adds a row to your spreadsheet.
hints: This workflow is perfect for form responses, lead tracking, or customer notifications
You'll need a Google account and an email service (Gmail works great!)
The whole setup takes about 10 minutes

steps.title: Download and Import the Workflow
steps.description: First, let's get this workflow into your n8n instance. Click the 'Download JSON' button on the workflow page, then in your n8n editor, click the menu (three dots) and select 'Import from File'.
steps.codeSnippet:
1. Click 'Download JSON' on the workflow page
2. Open your n8n instance
3. Click the menu icon (‚ãÆ) in the top right
4. Select 'Import from File'
5. Choose the downloaded JSON file
hints: Make sure you're logged into your n8n instance first
If you don't have n8n installed, visit n8n.io to get started
The workflow will appear in your canvas after import

steps.title: Connect Your Google Sheets Account üîó
steps.description: Now let's connect your Google account so n8n can monitor your spreadsheet for new rows. This is a one-time setup - you'll be able to reuse this credential for all Google Sheets workflows!
steps.codeSnippet:
1. Click on the 'Google Sheets' node in your workflow
2. Click on 'Credential to connect with'
3. Click 'Create New'
4. Select 'Google Sheets OAuth2 API'
5. Click 'Sign in with Google'
6. Choose your Google account
7. Click 'Allow' to grant n8n access
8. Click 'Save' in n8n
hints: You'll need to allow n8n to view and manage your spreadsheets
Make sure pop-ups are enabled in your browser for the OAuth flow
If you see an error, try using an incognito/private window
The credential is saved securely and can be reused in other workflows

steps.title: Select Your Spreadsheet üìä
steps.description: Choose which Google Sheet you want to monitor. The workflow will trigger every time a new row is added to this sheet.
steps.codeSnippet:
1. In the Google Sheets node parameters:
   - Resource: Select 'Sheet'
   - Operation: Select 'Get Rows'
2. Click 'Spreadsheet' dropdown
3. Select your spreadsheet from the list
4. Choose the specific sheet tab (e.g., 'Sheet1')
5. Set 'Range' to 'A:Z' to capture all columns
hints: Don't have a sheet? Create a test one with columns like: Name, Email, Message
Make sure the sheet has at least one row with headers
You can always change which sheet you're monitoring later
The trigger will only fire for NEW rows added after activation

steps.title: Configure Email Settings ‚úâÔ∏è
steps.description: Set up your email service to send notifications. You can use Gmail, Outlook, SendGrid, or any SMTP server. For this tutorial, we'll use Gmail with an App Password for security.
steps.codeSnippet:
For Gmail (Recommended):
1. Enable 2-Factor Authentication on your Google account
2. Go to Google Account > Security > 2-Step Verification
3. Scroll down to 'App passwords'
4. Generate a new app password for 'Mail'
5. Copy the 16-character password

In n8n:
1. Click the 'Send Email' node
2. Select 'Gmail' as the email service
3. Create new credential
4. Enter your Gmail address
5. Paste the app password (NOT your regular password)
6. Click 'Save'
hints: NEVER use your regular Gmail password - always use an App Password
For other services, check their SMTP settings documentation
SendGrid and Mailgun offer generous free tiers for higher volume
Test with a free email service before using production credentials

steps.title: Customize Your Email Template üìù
steps.description: Now let's personalize the email that gets sent. You can use data from the Google Sheets row to create dynamic, personalized messages.
hints: The {{ }} syntax pulls data from the previous node
Make sure your column names match what you put in the template
You can also set a fixed 'To' email if you want all notifications to go to you
Test with your own email first before sending to others

steps.title: Activate and Test Your Workflow üöÄ
steps.description: Time to bring your automation to life! Let's activate the workflow and test it by adding a new row to your Google Sheet.
steps.codeSnippet:
1. Click the 'Active' toggle in the top right (it should turn green)
2. Open your Google Sheet
3. Add a new row with test data:
   - Name: Test User
   - Email: your-email@example.com
   - Message: Testing my first n8n workflow!
4. Wait 30-60 seconds for the trigger to run
5. Check your email inbox (and spam folder)
6. Check n8n's 'Executions' tab to see the workflow run
hints: Polling triggers check every 60 seconds by default
If using Gmail, check your Spam folder first
Look at the execution log in n8n to debug any errors
Green checkmarks mean success! Red X's mean something needs fixing
You can manually test individual nodes by clicking 'Test step'

steps.title: Tutorial Complete! üéâ
steps.description: Congratulations! You've successfully set up your first automated workflow. Every time a new row is added to your Google Sheet, an email will be sent automatically. This is just the beginning - you can now customize this workflow or explore 150+ other templates!
hints: Try adding more nodes to send Slack messages, update a database, or create calendar events
Explore other workflows in the FlowKit library
Join the n8n community on Discord to share your creations
Remember to deactivate test workflows to avoid unexpected charges
